author: martin
title: Bible Soap Opera: Demo Episode
subtitle: Learn the whole Bible. Find Jesus in every story.

slides.content:
Hello.

Welcome to this drama lesson.

Today we are going to learn about Abraham and how he trusted God's word.

First, can you remember when God asks Abraham to sacrifice his son Isaac?

If you have a Bible, you can read Genesis chapter 22.

Click when you're ready.

slides.text: Let’s hear the story of Paul and his friends now.

slides.content:
Hello again.

Our friend Paul is in trouble. Why is Paul's uncle asking for the TV back? What will he do? Will he listen to David, or to Samson?

We'll come back to the story soon.

First, some questions for you to talk about in your group.

slides.question: What did Paul’s uncle give him as a gift?

feedback.content: Yes, Paul's uncle gave him a TV
No, Paul's uncle didn't gave him a phone
No, Paul's uncle didn't gave him a football
Please try again
Good stuff.

slides.question: What does Paul’s uncle want Paul to do with the TV now?

feedback.content: No, Paul's uncle doesn't want him to keep the TV
Yes, Paul's uncle does want him to give it back
Please try again

slides.content: How does Paul feel about this?
Paul feels confused. He thought his uncle was kind, but now he’s not sure. He also feels ashamed. His neighbours will laugh at him if he gives back the TV.

slides.question: Who said this: 'Abraham must have done something wrong, and so God is taking away the promises by taking away Isaac.'

feedback.content: You're right! Well done.
Sorry, David didn't say that, Samson did.
Hmm. You need to make a clearer decision. Was it David or Samson? Please try again.
Let's move on ...

slides.question: Who said this: 'Abraham learnt about resurrection. So even if Abraham died without the promises coming true in his lifetime, Abraham wouldn’t miss out on any'

feedback.content: You're right! Well done.
Sorry, David didn't say that, Samson did.
Hmm. You need to make a clearer decision. Was it David or Samson? Please try again.
Let's move on ...

slides.question: <small>David said to Paul: 'You know, many years later, another loved son was obedient, and offered himself as a sacrifice. But this son was provided by God. And he came back from death.' Who is the son that offers himself?</small>

feedback.content: Yes
No
No
Please try again
Good stuff.

slides.content:
Jesus is the lamb that God provides.

Let's get back to our story...

slides.question: Who would you listen to if you were Paul?

feedback.content: Hmm. Will Samson's advice turn out to be the best?
Hmm. Will David's advice turn out to be the best?
Hmm. It can be hard to pick.

slides.content: Well, that’s a happy ending. Paul decided to trust his uncle. His uncle was always being kind, even when Paul didn’t understand his words. We learnt that Abraham learnt to trust God – even beyond death. How about you? When do you find it hard to trust God’s Word? You can talk about this with your group now.

We hope you enjoyed this demo episode.

Written by Martin Olmos and Joe Radkovic.

Acting by Samuel Gates, Ruth Lee, Luke Forster, and Harry Martin.

This project aims to help christians with an oral culture learn how the whole Bible fits together, with Jesus at its heart. Follow this project at biblesoapopera.com
